attributes.action: Introduce a minimum custodial sentence for physical assault on emergency workers
attributes.additional_details:
10,410 assaults causing injury to a Constable in 2019/20(ONS).
November 2018/19, almost 20,000 offences were charged under the  Emergency Workers Act, 75% of which were by beating(CPS).
The number of assaults against emergency workers increase yearly. The max. sentence for drug dealing is 14 years, whereas assault is only 1 year. Some dealers admit to assaulting police to conceal evidence as the sentence is significant lower than dealing. Make criminals think twice before they assault workers.
attributes.background: At present, the maximum sentence for assaulting an emergency worker is 1 (one) year custodial. This is no deterent to criminals. I'd like to see a minimum of a 5 (five) year custodial sentence introduced to deter criminals from assaulting the people that protect the public and save lives daily.

rejection.details:
